New Records: Jackson Chourio hit four home runs in his last eight games, putting himself on the cusp of a 20/20 season at 20 years old.
Key Match Events: Brewers' Jackson Chourio hit a tying home run in the third inning
Brewers' Jackson Chourio hit a tying double in the fifth
Brewers' Willy Adames hit an RBI double in the 11th inning
Cardinals took advantage and scored in the 11th and 12th, sending Milwaukee to a 7-4 loss
Pre-Game Insights: Brewers manager Pat Murphy emphasized the importance of staying mentally tough against good pitching
Post-Match Reflections: Brewers manager Pat Murphy expressed frustration with the team's quiet bats in the late innings
Brewers manager Pat Murphy praised Jackson Chourio's performance saying 'he was terrific again today'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brewers inched closer to playing October baseball for the sixth time in the last seven years
A Cubs loss means the Brewers remained 10 games atop the National League Central with 23 games to play
